lines.gurmukhi: rqn pwrK imil rqn prIKw hoq gurmuiK hwt swt rqn ibauhwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ratan Paarakh Mili Ratan Pareekhaa Hota , Gurmukhi Haat Saat Ratan Biuhaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The genuineness of a gem can only be assayed by some connoisseur of the trade. Similarly an alert and attentive Sikh of the Guru trades in the purchase of jewel like Naam at the shop of a True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: mwnk hIrw Amol min mukqwhl kY gwhk cwhk lwB lBiq Apwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Maanak Heeraa Amol Mani Moukataahal Kai , Gaahak Chaahak Laabh Labhati Apaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who is genuinely interested in the trading of the diamonds, pearls, rubies and precious stones, he alone makes maximum profit out of it. Similarly true devotees and disciples of the Guru trade in the commodity of True Naam and make their life profitabl

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq Avgwhn ibswhn kY prm inDwn pRym nym gurduAwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Avagaahan Bisaahan Kai , Param Nidhaan Praym Naym Gurduaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By engrossing the mind in the divine word and trading in the commodity of Naam and Shabad (divine word), True Guru blesses his disciple with the treasure of love.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sMiD imil sMgm smwgm kY mwieAw mY audws Bv qrq sMswr hY ]67]
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Sandhi Mili Sangam Samaagam Kai , Maaiaa Mai Udaas Bhav Tarat Sansaar Hai ?67?

Shabad OS B.translation: When a true servant meets with True Guru; when he joins the loving and devoted congregation of the Guru, such a disciple who is ever in attendance of the Guru remains aloof and unsullied of maya (mammon). He sails across the worldly ocean with impunity. (
